text: was examined and testified as follows:
-  -  - EXAMINATION

Hi.  My name is Patricia Bilardo and I represent Ms. Charles.  She's the other defendant that was named as a defendant in this lawsuit.  I know that you sat here and you heard some instructions that were given to the two other witnesses, but just so our record is clean, I'm going to give you some instructions.  Have you ever given a deposition before?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So this is really more for your benefit than anyone else's.  There's a court reporter seated to your right, at the end of the table.  His job is to literally take down every answer that you give and every question that I ask. In order for him to do that accurately, only one of us can talk at one time. I see that you nod your head.  He cannot put any verbal gestures onto the record.  So if there's a question that requires an answer, I ask that you just please give an answer.  If you forget to do that, I'll remind you. Your attorney is seated to your left.  If at any time you need to speak with your attorney, use the restroom, get anything to drink, we can go off the record. You can do that.  The only thing that I do ask is that you answer the question that's currently pending, because it just makes it easier for the court reporter, so we don't have to all remember where we were.
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And then take a break.
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'm gonna ask you -- just to give you a road map, I'm gonna ask you about your background first before we even get to the accident that we're here for today.
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And all the answers that you give, we ask that you answer them to the best of your knowledge.  I'm not here to try to trick you, so if there's a question that I ask you and you do not understand the question, please don't answer it.  Just tell me, "I do not understand the question," because perhaps I can rephrase it in a way that you can answer it. And if there's something that you just don't know, that's okay as well.  But what happens afterwards is a little booklet gets prepared.  All the answers and the questions are in there.  And if you answer a question that you didn't understand, then it's not helpful to anyone, you know, at any other proceeding.
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: It's just better that you tell me that.
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And if there's a question that I ask you in reference to speed, distance, or time, a lot of times, people wouldn't know the exact speed, the exact time, or the exact distance.  It's not as if you get out and measure.  But if you can give an approximate answer, then we ask that you do that. But if you are giving an estimate, we ask that you say, "This is an estimate."  You know, this way it's clear to everyone here that you're estimating and that you're not saying that something is just true.
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay?  So by way of background, what is your full name?  And if you could spell it, this way, the court reporter can make sure that we have it accurate.
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Tracey, T-R-A-C-E-Y, A. Proietto, P-R-O-I-E-T-T-O.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What is your current home address?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: 63 Varnum Road, Norristown, PA 19403.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And is that --
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Could you spell the street for the reporter, please.
speaker: MR. BRANCA

text: 63 Varnum, V as in Victor, A-R, N as in Nancy, U, M as in Mary, Road.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Thank you.
speaker: MR. BRANCA

text: And is that where you lived on the date of this accident?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And are you single or married?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Married.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what is it that you do for a living?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: I am a secretary.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where do you work and how long have you been there?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Marshall Street Elementary School, which is the Norristown Area School District.  And I've been employed there approximately 19 years.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what is your highest level of education?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Montgomery County Community College, two years.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you get an associate's degree there?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And how old are you today?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Where were you coming from at the time of the accident and where were you going, meaning what was your destination?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: 63 Varnum Road.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: That's where you were coming from?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where were you intending to go?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Back to work, 1525 West Marshall Street.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recall the date of the accident independently?  Like would you --
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- remember when it was?  When was it?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: It was a Tuesday, I believe, approximately 12:20.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: In the afternoon?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And the accident report indicates that it was on June 20 of 2017.  Does that seem correct?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And when you said that you were going to work, was that the first time you'd been to work that day, or did you go to work, go home, and go back?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Went to work, went home, went back.  I went home to let -- we had had -- we have a new dog.  So I went home to let the dog out, which I did every day.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And do you get a certain lunchtime?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: And do you have to adhere to that lunchtime, meaning you have to be back by 1:00 o'clock?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How far is the school from your -- from where this accident --
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Approximately --
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- happened?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: -- seven minutes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was anyone else in the vehicle with you?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Just do me a favor.  I know you know sometimes what Counsel is gonna ask, but just let her finish her whole question before you answer, okay? so the court reporter -- otherwise, you'll make it hard on him, okay?
speaker: MR. BRANCA

text: I thought I was.  Sorry.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was anyone else in the vehicle with you at the time?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And are you familiar with the area where this happened?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you travel that often?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Very often.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And how many days a week approximately, if you know?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: That particular intersection, I probably go to at least three times a day.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So I'm going to show you a picture that I printed out, and I believe that this may represent your direction of travel.  So take the time to look at it, and let me know if that is the case.
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Thank you.
speaker: MS. PAUL

text: You're welcome.
speaker: MR. BRANCA

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  So I'm gonna mark this as Exhibit 1.
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: (Exhibit 1 marked for identification.)
And can you describe the roadway that you're on at the time, meaning is it a two-way road, one-way road? Like the name of the road you're on, is that Schuylkill Road?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: The name of the road I was on was -- yes, South Schuylkill Avenue.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Does that run two-way, meaning traffic can come both ways?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And how many lanes are there each direction?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: One.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And the police report indicates that the accident occurred at the intersection of Schuylkill and Main Street.  Would that be accurate?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: That's accurate.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And on Main Street, how many lanes of travel are there total when you're talking about both directions of travel?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Four, I believe.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And how many would that be each way?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Four each way -- two each way.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What were the weather conditions like on the date of this accident?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Dry.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were the roads dry as well?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was there any obstruction of your view when you entered this intersection, meaning could you see to your right and see to your left?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yes, I could see to my right and I could see to my left.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So was there any obstruction of view whatsoever?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When you approached the intersection, what color was your light?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Green.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was there any other vehicle in front of you as you approached the intersection, or were you the first one?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: I was the first one.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How far back would you say were you when you observed that your light was green?  Like how many yards, feet were you --
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Approximately -- approximately, a car length.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So at one point as you're approaching the intersection, did you observe that your light was red?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yeah.  I was at a complete stop.  I was at a complete stop at a red light before I proceeded through the intersection.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So when you approached the light --
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: It was red.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: It was red.
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: I was at a complete stop.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So prior to the accident happening, you were at a complete stop?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: At a red light, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And at some point, it changed to green?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How long did you wait between the time it changed from red to green to start going?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Approximately, three to five seconds.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And did you look to your left and your right before entering the intersection?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you see any vehicles coming from your left or from your right?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: I saw vehicles on my left, one in each lane.  They were at a complete stop on my left.  On my right, I saw one vehicle on the far side of the intersection, at a complete stop.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And when you say "to the far side of the intersection" --
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Curb -- like the curbside, the far curbside on Main Street.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And that would be -- do you know north, south, east or west?  Do you know the directions?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: I was traveling north.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And I know what you're saying.  It's just that --
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yeah.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- I don't want --
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: It's okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I don't want to put words in your mouth, so --
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: I was traveling north.  I know we didn't discuss this, but Ms. Gauger was traveling south on the opposite side of where I was.  I saw her as well.  So on my right would be traveling west, I believe.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: That is correct.  I --
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yeah.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I just wanted to make sure that --
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: West.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- we're all on the same page and -- in far as -- so when you say you saw a vehicle stopped, I'm gonna show you a picture.
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: We're gonna mark it as Exhibit 2.
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: (Exhibit 2 marked for identification.)
So I'm gonna show you another picture, and this would be a picture showing Main Street.  So just orient yourself with the picture before I ask you any questions. Do you recognize where that is?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So when you say that you saw a vehicle stopped to your right, in the curb lane, do you recognize where that curb lane is in --
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Right here.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- on Exhibit 2?  So you're pointing to where the bus is --
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- in the photo?  What type of vehicle was that? Was that the vehicle that you had the accident with or --
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- was it another vehicle?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: It was a -- it was a dark car, but I have no idea what it was or what color it was.  It was definitely a car.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And when you looked to your right, did you see any other vehicles coming from your right on West Main Street?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yes.  I saw the blue BMW.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: That would be to your left or to your right?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: That was to my left.  They were in the -- they were in this lane right here.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you're pointing to --
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: The blue BMW was in this lane.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You're pointing to the left lane?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yes.  And then, there was also a vehicle -- make and model, I have no idea.  I just know this one was a BMW 'cause it was a convertible, and it was down.  BMWs tend to catch your eye.  But yeah.  That was -- the BMW was here, and there was another vehicle stopped at a complete stop here.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Pointing to the right lane --
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- on eastbound Main Street.  I'm just narrating --
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: That's fine.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- for the record. When you looked to your right, did you see any other vehicle aside from that vehicle that you mentioned that was at a complete stop --
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- in the far --
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- right-hand lane? Now, you sat here through the other depositions.  You had the opportunity to meet Ms. Charles. Did you see her vehicle at all --
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- prior to this accident?  Where was it when you saw it?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Directly across from me, in the -- would be the right-hand lane here.  But if I'm looking, it was in the left-hand lane.  It was right here.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'm talking about Ms. Charles, the one that just left.
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Oh, Ms. Charles.  No, I didn't see her at all.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Did you --
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: I'm sorry.  I -- you said "Ms." -- I thought you said "Ms. Gauger."
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Ms. Charles.  Did -- no.  The woman that just left --
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Was Ms. Charles.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- was Ms. Charles.
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: I'm sorry.  I thought you said "Ms. Gauger."
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: No.  That's okay.  Did you see her vehicle at all --
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Not at all.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- prior to the accident?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So what I'm gonna have you do is tell us, in your words, how the accident happened.  And then I'll back in from there the questions.  I think that might be a little bit easier.  Because of there being multiple vehicles --
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Right.  Right.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- involved, you might be confusing the names of the parties.
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay?  And if you could describe the vehicles in any way as you're talking about what happened, that would be helpful, either by color, whether it be an SUV.  Like you said "the blue convertible."
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: That's helpful for us to piece it all together.
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Okay.  So I was traveling north on Schuylkill Avenue.  I was stopped at a red light.  The light changed from red to green.  I proceeded through the intersection. And I felt impact and my airbag deployed.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And after the accident happened, did you -- did you realize what had happened?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Well, I realized I was involved in a collision, but what exactly happened, no.  I honestly -- I didn't -- I didn't know what hit me.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And I'm going to show you an exhibit that I'm going to mark as Exhibit 3.
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: (Exhibit 3 marked for identification.)
Thank you.
speaker: MR. BRANCA

text: And I just handed you Exhibit No. 3.  Do you recognize what's in that photo?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What is that a picture of?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: My vehicle.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And does that picture accurately represent how your vehicle looked after this accident happened?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: In that picture, it shows a front-end impact.  Was your vehicle impacted on the passenger side in any way? Like was there any impact to your passenger side?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: I don't recall.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was there any impact to your driver's side?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: After the initial impact that you had where you said that your airbags deployed, did you hit anything else?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you only have one impact?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you see what happened next, or because your airbag deployed, you don't know?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: I don't know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What do you recall next?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: I recall my -- my car shutting down and then continuing straight, rolling right through the intersection, onto South Schuylkill Avenue, still in my lane.  And then it finally just came to a stop and died. It -- it just stopped.  It wasn't running.  It just, you know, rolled through and just stopped.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know what the speed limit is for you on Schuylkill Avenue in that area?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Twenty-five miles per hour.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know what your speed was approximately at the time of this accident?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: I would say approximately six to eight miles an hour.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: After you got out of the vehicle, did you speak with anyone else at the scene?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Well, I couldn't get out of the vehicle.  And the smoke -- I've never been in an accident, but the smoke from the airbag, I thought my car was on fire.  So I kind of panicked. And there were two -- there was a gentleman.  I believe he was painting on that street, painting a house.  He got me out of my vehicle.  So he was the initial person that I spoke with, but I don't know his name or anything.  I just know he was doing -- I actually seen him there the -- the -- the couple days before that, doing -- doing work. I believe he was painting or doing contractual work on a house.  He came -- he came to my car and got me out.  But he's the -- he's the person that I spoke with as soon as I got out of my car.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: After you did get out of the vehicle, do you recall speaking with any of the other drivers that were involved?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Now, you heard testimony that there were other vehicles involved, Ms. Gauger's vehicle, the BMW.  Did you see any of those impacts?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you speak with the police at the scene?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what do you recall telling the police?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: That somebody ran a red light.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you heard testimony that there was a young man that was taking pictures at the scene?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you ever speak with him?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you ever take your own pictures at the scene?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Not at the scene, no.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And did you take any pictures at all?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: I took those pictures that you're passing around from -- I believe it's where it was towed.  I can't remember the name of the place.  Dileo's?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So there are pictures of your vehicle.  Other than the pictures of your vehicle, did you take any other pictures of anybody else's vehicle?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: After you left the scene of the accident, did anyone call you on the phone at any time to talk to you about the accident?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: No.  Well, I -- nobody called me about the accident.  I went to the hospital.  I was transported to the hospital by ambulance.  When I got home from the hospital, I called the insurance company to report the incident.  That's the only person that I spoke with.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And did you give them a recorded statement at any time?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And do you remember if that was the same day as the accident?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: It was the same day, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you try to contact any of the other drivers at any other time?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Have you ever met Ms. Charles that just left here, my client --
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- prior to this accident?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Have you ever spoken to Ms. Gauger at all prior to this accident?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Are you aware of any witnesses that may have seen the accident?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Just the one that was listed in the police report.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Would you have known that person was even a witness had it not been listed in the police report, by your independent knowledge?  Like would you have spoken with him at the scene --
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- and said, "Are you a witness?"
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you have the opportunity to observe what damages, if any, were done to the other vehicles after the accident?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know what vehicle your vehicle impacted with, like whose vehicle you had an impact with?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Ms. Charles'.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And do you only know that because that's something that you learned after the fact, or is that something that you knew on the date of the accident?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Repeat your question.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Well, there were multiple vehicles involved in the accident.
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: Correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So at the scene of the accident, would you have been able to say, "I had an accident with this year, make, and model of this vehicle"?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: No.  I would not, no.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you even know where Ms. Charles had an impact?
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I don't have any other questions.
speaker: MS. BILARDO

text: I don't have any questions either.
